etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in The Times. From rag + work

definitions: The process of making a fabric out of rags by weaving, sewing, or other means; the fabric thus made.

etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in John Henry Parker (1806–1884), writer on architecture and publisher. From rag + work

definitions: Masonry composed of flattish pieces of ragstone, with an undressed surface.
